Method_Description: Best 3 of 4 injections; Accepted deviation up to 0.1 milligram_per_liter or 2 percent coefficient of variation;  Injection volume: 150 microliters; Furnace temperature: 720 degC; Standard concentration ranges 0-40 milligrams_Carbon_per_liter

Conductivity detection was used for all ions (fluoride; chloride; bromide; sulfate; phosphate; lithium; sodium; ammonium; calcium; magnesium; potassium) except nitrate and nitrite which are detected via ultraviolet (UV) absorbance. Injection volume: 0.5 milliliters. Standard concentration ranges (mg/L): (fluoride: 0-4) (chloride: 0-20) (bromide: 0-20) (sulfate: 0-20) (phosphate: 0-40) (nitrate: 0-20) (nitrite: 0-20) (lithium: 0-10) (sodium: 0-40) (ammonium: 0-50) (potassium: 0-100) (magnesium: 0-50) (chloride: 0-100). Eluent used for cations: MSA at a concentration gradient of 0.5 to 11 to 0.5mM. Eluent used for anions: KOH at 30mM.

Online acidification with 8 percent hydrochloric acid; sparge time for 2 minutes and 30 seconds; 3 washes of the syringe; Injection volume: 150 microliters; Furnace temperature: 720 degC; potassium hydrogen phthalate standard with concentration ranges 0-30 milligrams_per_liter; standards made within 7 days of run and kept at 4 degC between runs; Best 3 of 5 injections; Accepted deviation up to 0.1 milligrams_per_liter or 2 percent coefficient of variation.

Sparge time for 2 minutes and 30 seconds; 3 washes of the syringe; Injection volume: 150 microliters; Furnace temperature: 720 degC; potassium nitrate standard with concentration ranges 0-3 milligrams_per_liter; standards made within 7 days of run and kept at 4 degC between runs; Best 3 of 5 injections; Accepted deviation up to 0.1 milligrams_per_liter or 2 percent coefficient of variation.
Non-filterable residue was dried at temperatures between 103 degC and 105 degC. Total suspended solids was calculated gravimetrically.
Vials were intact and filled to appropriate levels.
Vials are not broken and are frozen as expected. No precipitate or suspended particles.

Bottles were intact and not leaking.

Vials were placed on blue ice after collection and then stored at 4 degC (refrigerator) until they were transferred or shipped to PNNL-Sequim Campus. Vials were placed under blue ice while in transit. At PNNL-Sequim Campus they were stored at 4 degC.

Vials were placed on blue ice after collection in the field and then frozen at -20 degC until they were transferred or shipped to PNNL-Sequim Campus. Vials were shipped or transfered frozen and placed under blue ice while in transit. Once arriving to PNNL-Sequim Campus they were stored at -20 degC or -80 degC.

Vials were placed on blue ice after collection and then stored at 4 degC (refrigerator) until they were transferred or shipped to PNNL-Sequim and/or Richland campuses. Vials were placed under blue ice while in transit. At PNNL-Sequim and/or Richland campuses they were stored at 4 degC.

Vials were placed on blue ice after collection and then stored at 4 degC (refrigerator) until they were transferred or shipped to PNNL-Sequim Campus. Vials were placed under blue ice while in transit. At PNNL-Sequim Campus they were stored at 4 degC.
Vials were placed on blue ice after collection and then stored at 4 degC (refrigerator).
Samples were filtered in the field to 0.22 microns and kept at 4 degC until analysis for no longer than one month.
Samples were filtered in the field to 0.22 microns and kept on ice upon collection and later frozen at -20 degC.
Samples were filtered in the field to 0.22 microns and kept at 4 degC until analysis for no longer than 14 days.
Samples were filtered in the field to 0.22 microns and kept at 4 degC until analysis for no longer than 14 days.
Storage at 4 degC was the only preservation.
Samples were brought to room temperature before analysis. Samples were diluted if concentrations were anticipated to be too high for instrument responses.
Samples were thawed morning of instrument run or overnight at 4 degC (refrigerator). Samples were diluted if needed (high metals or salts).
Samples were brought to room temperature before analysis. Samples were diluted if concentrations were anticipated to be too high for instrument responses.
Samples were brought to room temperature before analysis. Samples were diluted if concentrations were anticipated to be too high for instrument responses.
2 liter water samples were filtered through each 47 millimeter glass fiber filter (GF/F).

Manually checked data and calibration curves prior to uploading data. Raw data was processed through a data evaluation script that flagged samples below limit of detection and outside of the standard curve. The coefficient of variation (CV) was calculated among replicates; samples were flagged if CV was outside a given threshold. The flags indicate the limits of detection and CV where applicable.

Manually checked peak identification. Checked peak shape and calibration curves prior to uploading data. Raw data was processed through a data evaluation script that flagged samples below limit of detection and outside of the standard curve. The coefficient of variation (CV) was calculated among replicates; samples were flagged if CV was outside a given threshold. The flags indicate the limits of detection and CV where applicable.

Raw data was processed through a data evaluation script that flagged samples below limit of detection and outside of the standard curve. The coefficient of variation (CV) was calculated among replicates; samples were flagged if CV was outside a given threshold. The flags indicate the limits of detection and CV where applicable.
Raw data was processed through a data evaluation script that flagged samples below limit of detection established by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
Fluoride coefficient of variation (CV) was higher than the set threshold. Threshold value is listed after the underscore in the flag text.
Sulfate coefficient of variation (CV) was higher than the set threshold. Threshold value is listed after the underscore in the flag text.
Fluoride blank was higher than limit of detection (LOD). Fluoride data was subsequently blank corrected to remove the high background.

Individual data cells contain sample concentration and a flag if the concentration measured was outside of the standard curve or below the limit of detection. Values for the maximum or minimum standard concentration or the limit of detection are contained in the data cell as part of the flag text. Example: "Bromide_0.00585_ppm_Below_LOD_0.026_ppm" means that the Bromide concentration was 0.00585 milligramas_per_liter (ppm) which was below the 0.026 milligrams_per_liter (ppm) limit of detection.
Bromide blank was higher than limit of detection (LOD). Bromide data was subsequently blank corrected to remove the high background.
